Name: Title and extent of operation of the Code
Description: Specifies the name and territorial applicability of the IPC.
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Punishment of offences committed within India
Description: States that anyone who commits an offence in India shall be punished under the IPC.
Punishment: As per the specific offence

Name: Punishment of offences committed beyond, but which by law may be tried within, India
Description: Provides that even if an act is committed outside India, if Indian law allows it to be tried in India, IPC will apply.
Punishment: As per the specific offence

Name: Extension of Code to extra-territorial offences
Description: IPC applies to Indian citizens outside India, offences on Indian registered ships and aircraft, and cybercrimes committed outside but impacting India.
Punishment: As per the specific offence

Name: Certain laws not to be affected by this Act
Description: States that IPC does not affect special/local laws unless otherwise stated.
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Definitions in the Code to be understood subject to exceptions
Description: Words defined apply subject to exceptions mentioned
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Sense of expression once explained
Description: An expression explained once will hold same meaning throughout
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Gender
Description: Masculine includes feminine
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Number
Description: Singular includes plural and vice versa
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Man”, “Woman”
Description: Man = male human being; Woman = female human being
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Person”
Description: Includes company, association or body of persons
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Public”
Description: Any class of public or community
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Servant of Government”
Description: Government employee or anyone legally authorized
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Government”
Description: Refers to Central or State Government
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “India”
Description: Territory of India as per law
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Judge”
Description: Any person legally authorized to give judgment
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Court of Justice”
Description: Includes judges empowered to act judicially
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Public servant”
Description: A comprehensive list including govt employees, police, etc.
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Moveable property”
Description: Includes corporeal property except land
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Wrongful gain”, “Wrongful loss”

Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Dishonestly”
Description: With intent to cause wrongful gain or loss
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Fraudulently”
Description: With intent to defraud
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Reason to believe”
Description: A belief held with sufficient cause
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Property in possession of wife, clerk or servant
Description: Presumed to belong to the master
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Counterfeit”

Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Document”
Description: Any matter expressed upon any substance with intent to be used as evidence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Electronic record”

Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Valuable security”
Description: Document securing legal right or obligation
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “A will”
Description: Legal declaration of testamentary intention
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Words referring to acts include illegal omissions

Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Act”, “Omission”
Description: Act = single or series of acts; Omission = not doing something legally bound to do
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
Description: Each is liable as if done by them individually
Punishment: Depends on offence

Name: When act is criminal due to knowledge or intention
Description: Liability based on mental element
Punishment: Depends on offence

Name: Effect caused partly by act and partly by omission
Description: Still criminal
Punishment: Depends on offence

Name: Co-operation by doing one of several acts
Description: When combined acts constitute offence, each liable
Punishment: Depends on offence

Name: Persons concerned may be guilty of different offences
Description: Even if involved in one act, different individuals can be guilty of different crimes
Punishment: Depends on offence

Name: “Voluntarily”
Description: Act done knowingly and intentionally
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Offence”
Description: An act punishable by law
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Special law”
Description: Law applicable to particular subject
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Local law”
Description: Law applicable to particular part of India
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Illegal”, “Legally bound to do”

Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Injury”
Description: Harm to body, mind, reputation or property
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Life”
Description: Human life
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Death”
Description: Death of a human being unless contrary appears
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Animal”
Description: Any living creature other than human
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Vessel”
Description: Anything made for conveyance by water
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Year”, “Month”
Description: As per the Gregorian calendar
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Section”
Description: Section of the Code
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Oath”
Description: Includes affirmation/substitution by law
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Good faith”
Description: Done with due care and attention
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: “Harbour”
Description: Giving shelter, food or aid to a criminal
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Punishments
Description: Lists types of punishment: death, life imprisonment, imprisonment (rigorous/simple), forfeiture of property, and fine
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Construction of reference to transportation
Description: Clarifies that “transportation” now means imprisonment for life or a term
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Commutation of sentence of death
Description: Appropriate government may commute death sentence
Punishment: Death → Life imprisonment or lesser

Name: Commutation of life imprisonment
Description: Government may commute life imprisonment to a lesser term (not exceeding 14 years)
Punishment: Life → Up to 14 years

Name: "Appropriate Government"
Description: Defines which government can commute sentence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Fractions of terms of punishment
Description: Life imprisonment = 20 years for calculation purposes unless specified otherwise
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Sentence may be partly rigorous or simple
Description: Allows court to split imprisonment as partly rigorous and partly simple
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Amount of fine
Description: Court may impose any amount of fine unless limits are specified
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Imprisonment for non-payment of fine
Description: Imprisonment may be imposed if fine not paid
Punishment: As per terms of court

Name: Limit to imprisonment when both fine and imprisonment are awarded
Description: Imprisonment for default of fine should not exceed 1/4th of max imprisonment
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Description of imprisonment for non-payment of fine
Description: Imprisonment type (rigorous/simple) depends on type of primary offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Imprisonment for default when offence punishable with fine only
Description: May be simple imprisonment up to certain durations
Punishment: Up to 2 months to 6 months based on fine amount

Name: Termination of imprisonment on payment
Description: Imprisonment ends once fine is paid
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Termination on proportional payment
Description: Partial payment leads to proportional reduction in sentence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Fine recoverable for 6 years or during imprisonment
Description: Fine enforceable within 6 years or while convict is in prison
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Limit of punishment for compound offences
Description: Offender shall not be punished for more than the maximum of the gravest offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Doubt in judgmentnot specifiedguilty of one of several offences
Description: Minimum punishment among doubtful offences applied
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Solitary confinement
Description: Allowed in case of rigorous imprisonment not exceeding 3 months
Punishment: Max 3 months in total

Name: Limit of solitary confinement
Description: Max 14 days at a time, intervals of at least 14 days, not >3 months in total
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Enhanced punishment for repeat offenders
Description: If convicted again under Chapters XII or XVII, may face enhanced punishment
Punishment: Enhanced punishment

Name: Act done by person bound or by mistake of fact believing himself bound by law
Description: No offence if act done under legal compulsion or mistake of fact believing so
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act of Judge acting judicially
Description: No offence if Judge acts judicially in good faith
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act done under Court judgment/order
Description: No offence for acts done under Court orders in good faith
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act justified or by mistake of fact believing so
Description: No offence if act done justified by law or believed to be so by mistake of fact
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Accident in doing lawful act
Description: No offence if harm caused by accident while doing lawful act with proper care
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act likely to cause harm to prevent greater harm
Description: No offence if act done without criminal intent to prevent other harm
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act of child under 7 years
Description: No offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act of child 7–12 of immature understanding
Description: No offence if child lacks sufficient maturity
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act of unsound mind
Description: No offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act by intoxication against will
Description: No offence if incapable of judgment due to involuntary intoxication
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Offence requiring intent by intoxicated person
Description: Knowledge attributed; intent not presumed
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act not intended to cause death or grievous hurt done by consent
Description: No offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act done by consent for person’s benefit
Description: No offence if act done in good faith with consent for benefit
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act for benefit of child or insane person by/with guardian consent
Description: No offence (with provisos)
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Consent under fear/misconception/insanity/child
Description: Such consent invalid
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Acts independently offences
Description: No exception where act is offence apart from harm caused
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Act for benefit without consent
Description: No offence if done in good faith (with provisos)
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Communication in good faith
Description: No offence if communication made in good faith
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Compulsion by threats
Description: No offence for acts under threat, except murder/offences against State
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Slight harm
Description: No offence if harm is trivial
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Things done in private defence
Description: No offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Right of private defence of body/property
Description: Defines right
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Right against act of unsound mind person etc.
Description: Same right as against sane person
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: No right against certain acts, limits to defence
Description: Defines limitations
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Private defence of body extends to causing death
Description: Lists circumstances where death may be caused
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Right to cause harm other than death
Description: Defines scope where death not justified
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Commencement/continuance of defence of body
Description: When defence begins and continues
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Private defence of property extends to causing death
Description: Lists when death may be caused
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Right to cause harm other than death in defence of property
Description: When other harm allowed
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Commencement/continuance of defence of property
Description: When defence begins and continues
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Right against deadly assault with risk to innocent
Description: Permits risk to innocent if necessary for defence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Abetment of a thing
Description: Instigating, engaging in conspiracy, or intentionally aiding a person to commit an offence
Punishment: Based on abetted offence

Name: Abettor
Description: Defines abettor as a person who abets offence
Punishment: Not Applicable

Name: Abetment in India of offences outside India
Description: If act would be offence in India, abettor is liable
Punishment: Based on abetted offence

Name: Punishment if act abetted is committed and no separate provision exists
Description: Same as for abetted offence
Punishment: Same as offence abetted

Name: Abetment when abetted person acts with different intention
Description: Abettor still liable
Punishment: Same as for abetted offence

Name: Liability when different act done than abetted
Description: Liable if likely consequence
Punishment: Punishment for act done

Name: Cumulative punishment for act abetted and act done
Description: Liable for both
Punishment: Combined punishment

Name: Liability for unintended consequence
Description: Abettor liable for the effect caused
Punishment: As per outcome

Name: Abettor present when offence committed
Description: Treated as principal offender
Punishment: Same as principal offender

Name: Abetment of offence punishable with death/life imprisonment, if not committed
Description: Up to 7 years + fine; if act causes harm, up to 14 years + fine
Punishment: 7 or 14 years + fine

Name: Abetment of offence punishable with imprisonment, if not committed
Description: One-fourth of max term for offence + fine; higher if abettor is public servant
Punishment: Varies

Name: Abetting offence by public or >10 persons
Description: Up to 3 years + fine
Punishment: 3 years + fine

Name: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with death/life imprisonment
Description: Up to 7 years + fine if offence committed; 3 years + fine if not
Punishment: 3 or 7 years + fine

Name: Public servant concealing design of offence it’s his duty to prevent
Description: If offence committed: 7 years (if punishable with death/life), else 1/2 of offender’s term; if not committed: 1/4 + fine
Punishment: Varies

Name: Concealing design to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
Description: If offence committed: 1/4 of punishment; if not: fine or up to 1/8 of punishment
Punishment: Varies

Name: Definition of criminal conspiracy
Description: When two or more persons agree to do an illegal act or a legal act by illegal means. Mere agreement is sufficient to constitute conspiracy for illegal acts.
Punishment: Not Applicable (Definition only)

Name: Punishment of criminal conspiracy
Description: - If the conspiracy is to commit an offence punishable with death, life imprisonment or rigorous imprisonment ≥ 2 years: same as for the offence. - In other cases: up to 6 months + fine or both.
Punishment: Same as abetted offence or up to 6 months + fine

Name: Waging war against the Government of India
Description: Waging, attempting to wage, or abetting war against India
Punishment: Death or life imprisonment + fine

Name: Conspiracy to commit offences punishable by Section 121
Description: Conspiring to wage war or overawe the government by criminal force
Punishment: Life imprisonment or up to 10 years + fine

Name: Collecting arms with intent to wage war
Description: Collecting men, arms, or ammunition to wage war
Punishment: Life imprisonment or 10 years + fine

Name: Concealing design to wage war
Description: Intent to facilitate war against India by concealment
Punishment: Up to 10 years + fine

Name: Assaulting President or Governor to compel/restrain lawful power
Description: Using force to influence or restrict constitutional authority
Punishment: Up to 7 years + fine

Name: Sedition
Description: Bringing or attempting to bring hatred, contempt, or disaffection toward the government by words, signs, or writing
Punishment: Life imprisonment + fine or 3 years + fine or fine

Name: Waging war against an Asiatic power allied with India
Description: Similar to Section 121 but against foreign ally
Punishment: Life imprisonment or 7 years + fine

Name: Depredation on territories at peace with India
Description: Robbery/violence in territories of friendly powers
Punishment: Up to 7 years + fine + forfeiture

Name: Receiving property taken during such war/depredation
Description: Knowingly receiving property captured in acts under 125 or 126
Punishment: Up to 7 years + fine + forfeiture

Name: Public servant voluntarily allowing prisoner of war/state to escape
Description: Intentional act by public servant
Punishment: Life imprisonment or up to 10 years + fine

Name: Public servant negligently allowing escape
Description: Negligence in duty leading to escape
Punishment: Up to 2 years + fine

Name: Aiding escape, rescuing or harbouring prisoner of war/state
Description: Knowingly helping escape or concealing such persons
Punishment: Life imprisonment or up to 10 years + fine

Name: Abetting mutiny, or attempting to seduce a soldier, sailor or airman from his duty
Description: Inciting or trying to persuade a soldier, sailor, or airman to revolt or disobey duty
Punishment: Life imprisonment or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Abetment of mutiny, if mutiny is committed in consequence
Description: Abetting mutiny which actually occurs due to such abetment
Punishment: Death or life imprisonment, or imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Abetment of assault by soldier, sailor or airman on his superior officer when in execution of his office
Description: Aiding or instigating a soldier/sailor/airman to assault their superior officer
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years, and fine
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Abetment of such assault, if the assault is committed
Description: If the assault mentioned in Section 133 is actually committed
Punishment: Same as Section 133: Up to 10 years and fine
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Abetment of desertion of soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Helping or encouraging military personnel to desert service
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Harbouring deserter
Description: Knowingly sheltering a deserter from the armed forces
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Deserter concealed on board merchant vessel through negligence of master
Description: Ship master negligently concealing a deserter
Punishment: Fine up to ₹500
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Abetment of act of insubordination by soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Instigating or helping military personnel to disobey superiors
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Persons subject to certain Acts
Description: Clarifies IPC application to persons governed by military/naval laws
Punishment: Not a penal section
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Wearing garb or carrying token used by soldier, sailor or airman
Description: Unauthorized use of military uniforms or marks
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to ₹500, or both
Category: Offences relating to the Army, Navy and Air Force

Name: Unlawful assembly
Description: Assembly of 5+ persons with a common unlawful object
Punishment: Not penal; defines the term

Name: Being member of unlawful assembly
Description: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly
Punishment: Not penal; defines membership

Name: Punishment for unlawful assembly
Description: Being a member of unlawful assembly
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Joining unlawful assembly armed with deadly weapon
Description: Participating with a deadly weapon
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Name: Joining or continuing in unlawful assembly, knowing it is ordered to disperse
Description: Defying lawful command to disperse
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Name: Rioting
Description: Use of force or violence by unlawful assembly
Punishment: Not penal; defines offence

Name: Punishment for rioting
Description: Participation in rioting
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Name: Rioting armed with deadly weapon
Description: Participation in rioting with weapon
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

Name: Offence by member of unlawful assembly
Description: Member held guilty of offence committed by assembly in pursuit of common object
Punishment: Punishment as per committed offence

Name: Hiring persons for unlawful assembly
Description: Hiring/encouraging people to join unlawful assembly
Punishment: Same as for member of unlawful assembly

Name: Knowingly joining assembly commanded to disperse
Description: Continuing after command to disperse
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Assaulting public servant suppressing riot
Description: Obstructing public servant during riot control
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both

Name: Wantonly giving provocation to cause riot
Description: Provoking with intent to riot
Punishment: If riot committed: 1 year or fine or both; if not: 6 months or fine or both

Name: Promoting enmity between groups
Description: On religion, caste, language, etc.
Punishment: Up to 3 years or 5 years (if in place of worship), and fine

Name: Carrying arms in procession or mass training
Description: Arms in processions/drills
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

Name: Imputations against national integration
Description: Speech or writing prejudicial to integration
Punishment: Up to 3 years or 5 years, and fine

Name: Owner of land where unlawful assembly held
Description: Landowner’s liability for unlawful gathering
Punishment: Same punishment as for unlawful assembly

Name: Beneficiary of riot
Description: If riot is committed for another’s benefit
Punishment: Same punishment as rioter

Name: Agent of beneficiary of riot
Description: Agent responsible for facilitating riot
Punishment: Same punishment as rioter

Name: Harbouring persons hired for unlawful assembly
Description: Providing shelter to hired rioters
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Being hired to take part in unlawful assembly or riot or to go armed
Description: Accepting hire to riot or bear arms
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Affray
Description: Fighting in public causing disturbance
Punishment: Not penal; defines affray

Name: Punishment for affray
Description: Engaging in affray
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to ₹100, or both

Name: Public servant disobeying law, with intent to cause injury
Description: Knowingly disobeying legal obligation to cause injury
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Public servant disobeying direction under law
Description: Especially in investigation of offences against women (e.g., rape, etc.)
Punishment: Rigorous imprisonment 6 months to 2 years, and fine
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Punishment for non-treatment of victim
Description: Hospital personnel not providing free medical treatment to rape or acid attack victim
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Public servant framing incorrect document with intent to cause injury
Description: Willfully framing wrong record or writing
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Public servant unlawfully engaging in trade
Description: Public servant involved in trade while in service
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Public servant unlawfully buying or bidding for property
Description: Bidding/purchasing property without authority
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Personating a public servant
Description: Pretending to be a public servant to gain advantage
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: Wearing garb or carrying token used by public servant with fraudulent intent
Description: Fraudulent imitation of appearance of public servant
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to ₹500, or both
Category: Of Offences by or Relating to Public Servants

Name: “Candidate”, “Electoral right” defined
Description: Defines the terms: candidate and electoral right
Punishment: Not a penal section

Name: Bribery

Punishment: Not penal itself; see Section 171E for punishment

Name: Undue influence at elections
Description: Interference with free exercise of electoral rights
Punishment: Not penal itself; see Section 171F for punishment

Name: Personation at elections
Description: Voting or attempting to vote in another's name
Punishment: Not penal itself; see Section 171F for punishment

Description: Bribery at elections
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both; if treating (food/drinks), then fine only

Name: Punishment for undue influence or personation
Description: Committing undue influence or impersonation during elections
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

Name: False statement in connection with an election
Description: Publishing false statements about a candidate’s character
Punishment: Fine only

Name: Illegal payments in connection with an election
Description: Unauthorized election expenses without candidate’s permission
Punishment: Fine up to ₹500

Name: Failure to keep election accounts
Description: Not maintaining required record of election expenses
Punishment: Fine up to ₹500

Name: Absconding to avoid service of summons
Description: Intentionally avoiding summons or legal process
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month (6 months if in criminal case), or fine, or both

Name: Preventing service or publication
Description: Obstructing lawful delivery of summons or public notice
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month (6 months if in criminal case), or fine, or both

Name: Non-attendance in obedience to order
Description: Failure to attend as required by legal summons
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month (6 months if in criminal case), or fine, or both

Name: Non-appearance under CrPC §82
Description: Failure to appear as declared a proclaimed offender
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine (7 years if declared offender)

Name: Omission to produce document
Description: Refusing to produce documents legally bound to produce
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month (6 months if criminal case), or fine, or both

Name: Omission to give notice/info
Description: Failure to give legally required information
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month (6 months if criminal case), or fine, or both

Name: Furnishing false information
Description: Giving false information to public servant
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Refusing oath or affirmation
Description: Refusing to take oath when legally required
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Refusing to answer questions
Description: Refusal to answer when bound to state the truth
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine, or both

Name: Refusing to sign statement
Description: Legally required signature refused
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine, or both

Name: False statement on oath
Description: Making a false statement under oath to public servant
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 years, and fine

Name: False information to public servant
Description: False report to cause injury via misuse of power
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to ₹1,000, or both

Name: Resistance to lawful property seizure
Description: Preventing lawful seizure of property
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 6 months, or fine up to ₹1,000, or both

Name: Obstructing property sale
Description: Hindering official auction or sale by public servant
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to ₹200, or both

Name: Illegal bid or purchase at official sale
Description: Unlawfully bidding in government-authorized sale
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to ₹200, or both

Name: Obstructing public servant
Description: Voluntarily obstructing public servant during duty
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 3 months, or fine up to ₹500, or both

Name: Omission to assist public servant
Description: Failure to assist public servant when bound by law
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 month, or fine up to ₹200, or both

Name: Disobedience to order by public servant
Description: Violating lawful order from public servant
Punishment: Simple imprisonment up to 1 month and/or ₹200 fine (6 months/₹1,000 if danger caused)

Name: Threat of injury to public servant
Description: Threatening injury to deter lawful actions
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years, or fine, or both

Name: Threat to deter person from seeking public protection
Description: Threatening someone to stop them from approaching a public servant
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 1 year, or fine, or both

Name: Giving false evidence
Description: Making a false statement under oath
Punishment: Not penal (defines offence)

Name: Fabricating false evidence
Description: Creating false documents/statements to mislead
Punishment: Not penal (defines offence)

Name: Punishment for false evidence
Description: Giving or fabricating false evidence
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 7 years and fine (3 years in other proceedings)

Name: False evidence to convict capital offence
Description: Giving evidence to convict someone of a capital offence
Punishment: Life imprisonment or death if executed

Name: False evidence to convict life/other imprisonment
Description: Giving evidence to convict of imprisonment for life or other term
Punishment: Imprisonment up to 10 years and fine

Name: Threat to give false evidence
Description: Threatening anyone to give false evidence
Punishment: Same as for false evidence
